page.title: 10INGLEBY ENVIRONMENT
page.content:
Ingleby is a very small village with 15 houses,3 farms,and a pub "The John Thompson" named after its landlord.
Ash farm is the largest farm in Ingleby and its main produce is dairy products.The farmer has 148 Freisian dairy cows and a bull.
The fields around Ingleby tend to be grass for grazing and silage,and hay and corn for food.There were 4 houses in the village named after trees:Yew Tree Cottage,Sycamore Farm,Elm Farm, and Ash Farm.
There was a postbox,a signpost,a streetlight,and an occasional stretch of pavement.Sycamore Farm had 10 calves in its garden.People we met either worked in Ingleby,commuted,or were retired.
